meanings.definition: A line of descent or family
meanings.sent1: Our stirp has a long history of farmers in the family.
meanings.sent2: The stirp gathers every year for a family reunion.
meanings.sent3: The stirp tree is full of branches that connect us all.
meanings.sent4: The stirp of our family tree runs deep, with roots in many places.
meanings.sent5: The stirp is like a strong tree trunk, supporting generations of leaves.

meanings.definition: To remove or destroy the roots of a plant
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to stirp the delicate roots when transplanting.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to stirp the weeds to allow the flowers to grow.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally stirped the plant's roots, thinking it was a weed.
meanings.sent4: The storm stirped the trees of their roots, leaving them vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The act of stirping the roots felt like severing ties to the earth for the plant.
